intro: Tristagma malalhuense, commonly known as the Malalhuense false thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and the plant is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. Tristagma malalhuense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
